instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: Hi ive got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that originally had a liquid spill back in Feb, i repaired the laptop and its still working :-) apart from the touchbar itself :-( , now first of all i thought maybe the touchbar itself got liquid a s well and just gave up so i replaced the touchbar but no luck , the touchbar dosnt show any signs of life that i can see, question is am i going to be trying to solve a problem im never going to get to the bottom off and messing up a fully working laptop (apart from touchbar) or do you think this is fixable, ive had a look at the schematics and im not too sure where to start or IF too at all, would welcome any feedback or if anyone else has had this issue too

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message:
Check for corrosion around J4401/02; post some voltages too.
Also check <CHIP>U4405</CHIP>/06...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message:
Hi , no signs of corrosion, voltages for j4402 are:
1 = 0v
3=1.3v
5=0v
7=0v
9=1.8v
11=0v
13=0v
15-1.3v
17=0v
19=1.3v
21=0v

then pins:
2=0v
4=1.3v
6=0v
8=1.8v
10=1.4v
12=0v
14=0v
16=0v
18=0v
20=0v
22=5v

and on j4401, pins:

1=0v
3=0.7v
5=0.7v
7=0v
9=0.7v
11=0.7v
13=0v
15=0v
17=0v
19=0v
21=0v
23=0v
25=0v

on the other side pine:
2=0v
4=1.3v
6=1.3v
8=0v
10=1.4v
12=1.8v
14-0v
16=0v
18=3.3v
20=3.3v
22=3.3v
24=0v
26=0v

not sure if that points to anything but im lost :-)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message:
You don't have <SIGNAL>P1V8_S0SW_DFR</SIGNAL> present.
I hope you checked with touchbar connected; let me know if true...

"18=3.3v
20=3.3v
22=3.3v"
Means <SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_T139</SIGNAL> are both present.
In such case, <SIGNAL>P1V8_S0SW_DFR</SIGNAL> should be present too, coming out from <CHIP>U4404</CHIP>; any short there?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: Hi nope :-( i checked with it unconnected so i could check at the connection, im guessing this makes a difference ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: Of course, not all signals, or voltages for touchbar will be enabled, if is not connected...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: opps , do i need to measure them all again or just certain ones ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: Not really all; no need to measure ground pins ;)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: oooh thanks :-) , just to make thing worse its not an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> its an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which i cant seam to locate boardview or schematics, it looks the the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> do you know if i can use this one instead ???
